text: The service was fantastic. Our waiter was knowledgable and kind. The meal was delicious. The poutine was out of this world fantastic. Deer tartare, yum. Goat cheese salad, take it or leave it, nothing special. I would definitely go back and maybe even try their brunch. Seems like a good table d'hote, too. I was a bit disappointed to be told that several menu items were unavailable but after all, I would rather have fresh items. Also, the drinks were completely average. Really really good price for the portions and the quality- that needed to be noted! :)
Vraiment très bon, excellent service, plusieurs spéciaux selon la journée. Différents mets de viande sauvage tout simplement merveilleux  (je viens d'une famille de chasseur)

Petit resto qui ne paye pas de mine à première vue mais où il fait bon s'asseoir: le résultat fut au delà de mes espérances!
Accueil chaleureux par un charmant serveur qui su nous conseiller et qui fut très patient avec la table d'à côté et sa clientèle principalement féminine
Un excellent burger de wapiti ou une bavette de brocard (chevreuil mâle) accompagnés de bonnes frites maison et une petite salade avec sauces au choix, un repas qui ne vous laissera pas indifférent!
N'hésitez pas à prendre la table d'hôte avec sa délicieuse soupe en entrée et des beignets patate frits, un met succulent comme je n'avais jamais mangé!
Bien que la fameuse cervoise ne se trouve pas sur la carte, on nous propose des bières locales en fût comme de la boréale, un grand classique qui a fait ses preuves.
Si vous êtes friands de viande qui sort de l'ordinaire, essayer cette place!
Delicious, affordable meal. The boar ribs were generous and very tasty. Fries were great, staff is very nice, alcohol is affordable. No frills, just the right thing.

Nous sommes ici pour le brunch du dimanche et nous avons commandé trois plats différents.  Tout est excellent ! Très bon service et les plats sont tous succulent ! L'assiette gauloise est énorme, le sanglier est superbement cuit et le gravelax est d'une douceur exquise.

Un bistro unique dans le quartier Hochelaga ! 
J'y ai mangé le meilleur burger de bison ! 
Les frites sont également excellentes ! 
À découvrir pour les viandes exotique qui y sont servis ! (Entre autre, du phoque et du kangourou !)
Delicious dinner. Insanely good poutine! The brunch is just not my cup of tea but the dinner I would go back over and over again. French onion soup is sweet and tasty. I love this place!

I've been here twice. Once on a Sunday for bison tartare (tartares are discounted on Sundays & Mondays) and on a Saturday for a deer burger. Both were good and definitely interesting. Texture is similar to beef but neither tasted like beef. Can't describe it really but there was no gaminess. I believe they also serve a poutine with shredded wapiti (elk) and a horse steak. I haven't tried either. Portions are small but considering the rarity of game meat, I think the prices are reasonable. It's a small place, more of a bar than a restaurant.

Parfait petit resto de quartier, repas rapide mais toujours bons. Parfait après une journée de travaille d'été, quand t'as pas envie de cuisiner! Ils varient bien la viande de bois avec une bonne frite allumette et ses mayos... Service un soupçon lent, mais vite devinée que la jeune serveuse, qui a toujours gardé son sourire, était seule un soir ou sa terrasse était pleine avec quelques clients à l'intérieur... Terrasse intéressante quoique vraiment sur le trottoir d'Ontario... Je vous le précise mais l'important c'est qu'il y en ait une. Bref, bonne bouffe, sans grand fla fla mais qui se démarque par son gibier, sevice courtois et bien sur, une autre belle petite place dans ce cher Homa qui essaie tant bien que mal à prendre sa place dans le grand monde culinaire

Une recommandation d'un amis. Bon choix de bière. J'ai pris le canard et c'était excellent. Menu élaboré. La musique suscitait la nostalgie (Bauhaus, New Order, etc).

À découvrir.

Parfait pour un diner ! Un service rapide et leurs burgers sont très bon ! 

Je le recommande !!

Le quartier d'HOMA commence à sérieusement m'impressionner autant par sa diversité de cuisine que la qualité de ses restaurants ... souvent à meilleur prix. Ce qui est intéressant  au Bistro LA Cervoise c'est son mixte entre bistro tradionnel et cuisine gibier non conventionnel. Dans le fond c'est comme être Gaulois sans y mettre pied. Ses bières sont intéressantes... par exemple j'ai eu la chance de goûter à un mixte bière blanche et cidre avec un soupçon d'anis.  Les plats sont définitivement non conventionnel du genéral tao au bison, ragoût de wapiti et saumon gravlax. Fan de gibier vous serez servis!

Il y a dessert en table d'hôtes mais comme mon ami Etienne dis ... le dessert yé ptit alors il faut en manger deux! Bon ce qui nous a pas dit c'est que le dessert additionnel soit aussi bon ... surtout le gateau au fromage à l'érable. Il manque juste une oreille de crist puis le compte est bon.

À la revoyure! Par Toutatis oussé qui yé ma Cervoise!  

P.S : En passant petit scoop pour vous yelpers .... le prochain Astérix est au Québec vous saviez pas ?

I had an item from their special selection, chevale. Horse meat. First time having horse. It was incredible. The grilled vegetables were amazing, with pesto, they included fiddle heads, my fav. And the poutine was quite unique with a Quebec blue cheese gravy. Salty and amazing. The best dinner I've had in Montreal so far. And the chef came out to ask me how my food was. I loved that.

Alors j'ai réservé à cet endroit une table pour 2. J'ai bien fait, car c'est un petit resto (40 places assises environ). C'était ma 2e visite à ce restaurant et encore une fois, je n'ai été déçu d'absolument rien!
Le restaurant est très 'cozy' avec une belle déco. Le staff sont très gentil et se sont assurer qu'on passait une belle soirée, un beau travail d'équipe.
Et que dire de la nourriture! Nous nous sommes séparés 4 entrées: Une salade de betteraves, un Chorizo, des crevettes et une chaudrée de moules. Sérieusement, ça a super bien commencé la soirée. Mon copain a pris les Fish & Chips d'aiglefins et j'ai pris le burger aux cerf rouge avec oignons caramélisés....ça fondait dans ma bouche! Très bons choix d'accompagnements, je vous suggère la salade de bok choy.
Pour le déssert, on s'est sucré le bec avec une verrine d'un gâteau forêt noire déconstruit et d'un Smores servit de la même façon avec leur excellente guimauve fait maison. Le serveur connaissait très bien son menu et nous a très bien servi (Kudos à Julien :o)  ).
Essayez de toujours réserver avant de vous présenter, ça vaut vraiment le détour. Côté prix, personnellement, je trouve ça très juste pour la qualité de la nourriture reçue. Une belle découverte pour un restaurant qui est quand même été dans Hochelaga depuis plusieurs années!

A true gem in this neighborhood, French cuisine at its best and the price is right too! Great service and nice ambience inside the restaurant. Had the duck confit which came with lovely fries and salad for 14 $! They also have 1 $ soup with the lunch special. I have had French food all over the world including Paris and Las Vegas and believe me this place is a true deal!!

Burger au cerf délicieux. Bon choix de bières. Portions généreuses et bon service dans ce petit resto propret. Seul bémol : Fish and chips aurait intérêt à utiliser une panure moins forte en bière ce qui masque tout le goût du poisson.

What I liked:

-Their blue cheese & braised game poutine was tasty
-The décor is nice
-Good location
-My deer hamburger wasn't  really a burger, but it was good

What I disliked:

-Their ribs were crazy dry, tough and still had the silverskin on them, in short: inedible 
-The crocodile bites were chewy and the batter was too thick

Will I go here again?
Probably not, but if I do find myself somehow in this place once more I will eat the poutine and warn everybody in my party to avoid the ribs at all cost.

When you have a comparison, you can easily pick on something you don't really care normally...

Like I said in the last review on another French restaurant close by, I don't eat nor speak French, the waitress here didn't really introduce the menu to me...  She pointed the first line say "fish and chips"... I mean, the English word "Fish and Chips" is there I think I can understand that... 

I told her I want some steak, she pointed another line say there is a horse-steak... I am not ready to eat a horse... So I ordered something from the Berger menu.... I really don't want to get American food in a French restaurant but what choice do I have???

Well, surprisingly the one I ordered is not "a Berger"' instead it is a stack of tartan beef, served with some bread, it tasted not bad... However the fries are like re-cooked...
Excellent endroit dans Hochelaga-Maisonneuve. La carte, renouvellée chaque semaine est impressionnante. Bon choix de vins. Pour la bière cependant pourrait faire mieux.

Overall it was a pleasant experience. Original menu for a bistro restaurant. Good for beers fans. The burgers were great, i tried the sanglier one. I find the food a little too salty tho. Interesting choice of tartars.

HoMa has really started to turn around and is actually starting to get some nice restaurants there.  La Cervoise is one of them.  This small restaurant on Ontario St. has a great ambiance and good food to go along with it.

To start I had a tomato zucchini salad which wasn't the best part of the meal and hence the reason I took off a star.  The tomatoes weren't very ripe and the salad was a little on the bland side.  The main course though was a definite rebound from the start of the meal.  I had boar ribs which fell away from the bone and were seasoned with a really nice sauce.  They came with fries and a choice of mayo (pesto, garlic, chili and I think there were one or two more choices).  I'm a fan of garlic mayo on my fries and this one was quite good.   Lastly I finished off with a chocolate mousse garnished with a raspberry coulis which was a great way to finish off a good meal.

I am a fan of this place and I'd recommend it to anyone if they're in the area.  It's a great little neighbourhood restaurant.
Nice and cozy place. Had the salmon tartare which was just perfect. Owner was serving and was super nice.

Absolutely horrible experience! We came in at 11:30 ordered food and didn't get our plates until 1pm! We had even told them we were in a rush because we have a World Cup game. Top it off our plateware silverware and glassware were dirty chunks of food dried to them. Salmon tartare a No. It's made with a creme mayo and duck confit crepe and five little pieces of duck and rest all crepe. So very disappointing and wasted most of our time our last day

I went for dinner with a friend, and we ended up splitting the duck wings, a pitcher of beer and dessert, with a main each.
Price was reasonable, and I left full and happy.

The barbecue duck wings were deliciously crispy on the outside and satisfying.

My main was the juniper berry deer tartare with fries and coleslaw.
The bread that came with the tartare was tender and toasted on the grill, which I liked way better than the super crispy crouton slab that some places serve with tartare, the tartare itself was interestingly seasoned and tasty, the fries were great, and even the coleslaw was creamy and interestingly peppery.

My friend had the salmon burger with smoked salmon, which had a salmon cake patty and came on a very tasty roll that looked homemade. The combination tasted amazing and I will go back just to have this.

Dessert was a maple mousse with apple jelly that was tasty and sweet and came in a mini portion that worked very well for two very full dinners who just want a last note of sweetness.

I also want to try their brunch and the rabbit general Tao entree, so basically, big thumbs up.

Atmosphere is nice and cozy, service was great, beer list was interesting.

Great meal, great deal! 
Went for lunch: The best wapiti burger ever. And the best deal of awesome zucchini soup for $1 and great dessert of pudding choumar with grape sorbet. My husband ordered bison sausage with a very tasty bacon coleslaw. You guys need to go! Hurry!

I went there twice
I had the fish and chips...it was a tiny bit too salty 
The restaurant itself is very small service is fast and friendly .
The second time i went ... we were a group of friends... we had the exotic meats platter  
Which included seal, camel,alligator and kangaroo..
This last dish was very good without being wow it was very good.
I like the way they try to be originals and do things no body else does 
.!!
